cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi ESE of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across central-western Cuba today, then north-northwest into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico and up the west coast of Florida before curving northeast along the U.S. Southeast coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida near the Tampa Bay/Big Bend region

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida Keys from east of Craig Key to Ocean Reef, Florida Bay, and the west coast of Florida from Englewood northward to the Aucilla River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas and the west coast of Florida from Flamingo to Englewood (plus Cuban provinces listed in advisory)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida Peninsula, Florida Gulf coast, coastal Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force wind gusts (35–45 mph) possible Tuesday afternoon through early Wednesday with an 18% chance of sustained 34-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of Florida where Port Canaveral is located.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated 6-inch amounts could cause localized flash or urban flooding Tuesday–Wednesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible across central Florida Tuesday; rough seas and higher surf developing late Tuesday.
